title: FirstEnergy's Utility Worker Training Partnerships with Community Colleges Begin New School Year
content:
SOURCE FirstEnergy Corp.

Power Systems Institute Programs Designed to Train Students to Work on Power Lines and in Substations

AKRON, Ohio 

The award-winning, two-year program is designed to train the next generation of FirstEnergy's utility line and substation workers. Of those currently enrolled in the Power Systems Institute programs at 12 schools in Ohio 

"Since we created this program in 2000, more than 1,100 Power Systems Institute graduates currently are working in the field as FirstEnergy utility employees, using the training they received from this unique program to help keep the lights on for our customers," said Steven E. Strah
